title: Fix broken `.pre-commit-config.yaml` configuration

labels.name: area: ci
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Continuous Integration (CI)

body:
Closes #2284

Hello!

## Pull Request overview
1. Fix broken `.pre-commit-config.yaml` configuration by reverting the changes to the file from e53c2018c6ae781f35845e07c8806ca68acea7fc.
2. Decrement `isort` version from 5.12.0 to 5.11.5, as the former no longer supports Python 3.7.

## Details
I ran the [`Prettier`](https://prettier.io/) formatter on the file as it stood before e53c2018c6ae781f35845e07c8806ca68acea7fc to normalize the structure of the file. YAML can be pretty specific, so it's best not to update the formatting manually too often.

Sadly, the `pre-commit` auto-update functionality will soon update the `isort` version back to 5.12.0+. I'm sure there are some better solutions, but I would be more than okay with stopping the autoupdates until we move to Python 3.8+. After all, there's only ~4 months left of Python 3.7 before modules really stop supporting it.

## After these changes
Whereas before a configuration error was thrown (see #2284), this is now the output of `pre-commit run` with no changes:
```python
check yaml...........................................(no files to check)Skipped
fix end of files.....................................(no files to check)Skipped
trim trailing whitespace.............................(no files to check)Skipped
Insert license header in Python source files.........(no files to check)Skipped
black................................................(no files to check)Skipped
isort................................................(no files to check)Skipped
```

- Tom Aarsen

title: [UI] Misalignment in prediction underline at line wrap

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body: Hello! ## Issue Overview * I've noted a misalignment in the light & thick and dark & thin prediction (underline) borders when the line wraps: ## Relevant screenshots ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37621491/216580549-dec83005-83f7-4856-84c0-f2ee14b8d756.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37621491/216580867-cbea19ff-61bf-495d-b1f7-bf4c15b90d8f.png) ## Reproduction Browse to https://argilla-live-demo.hf.space/datasets/team/gutenberg_spacy-ner-monitoring?query=e30&sort=W10&viewMode=explore&pagination=eyJzaXplIjoxMCwicGFnZSI6MX0 and observe the third record. Perhaps some messing with browser zoom levels is required, although for me it works with the default zoom on Firefox. ## Details On the prediction side of the HTML, each word is wrapped in a span like so: ```html the ::after ``` Such that the span is affected by the following CSS rule for the light & thick prediction line: ```css .color_15.prediction[data-v-9bc3bafe] .highlight__content { padding-bottom: 3px; border-bottom: 5px solid #c2efff; position: relative; } ``` This one is always correctly placed. However, because the designs asks for a secondary border, a common trick was used to place the second border: an `::after` tag (https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/multiple-borders/). This tag is affected by this CSS rule to apply the dark & thin prediction line: ```css .color_15.prediction[data-v-9bc3bafe] .highlight__content::after { content: ""; border-top: 1px solid #0091c2; position: absolute; top: 26px; left: 0; right: 0; } ``` However, unlike the `span`, this `::after` tag does *not* ignore the whitespace which is present in the text: `the `. This directly results in the bug. ## Proposed solution I propose the following changes: 1. Remove the `::after` from the prediction. Furthermore, the corresponding CSS rule should be removed too. This removes the sometimes misaligned underline. 2. Expand the span CSS rule responsible for adding the light & thick underline with: ```css box-shadow: 0px 1px 0px #0091c2 ``` Where 0px is the x-offset, 1px is the y-offset, 0px is the blur radius and #0091c2 should be replaced with the correct dark color that was previously used in the `::after` css rule. This simple alternative approach for providing multiple (underline) borders should solve this problem easily. ## After applying these changes ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37621491/216584746-bfd2ef44-2d3f-469d-b4b5-9d8db96c8bb8.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37621491/216584865-f2708354-ad15-4597-9e92-d0d870995118.png) - Tom Aarsen

title: Undo & Redo Actions

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
My use case is specifically for token classification where there are a lot of annotations per record but should be just as useful for other types too.
If the user accidentally clicks (x) on an annotation (or clicks "Clear annotations") or makes other types of mistake they have to manually tag it again. This is especially annoying if it is character level annotation & you are doing edits.
Additionally it would be nice to have a way to undo all actions done on a record in that session(? the actions that took place after first edit during `Pending` until `Validation`)
So the per record buttons would be "Save, Undo All, Clear Annotations"(these could be just emoji buttons too). So if a user edits a record it would go from 
`Validated->Pending-> annotate,annotate,annotate->clicks undo all->Validated (reverts all edits)`
This would also remove some confusion from the word 'discard'. Currently when being unfamiliar with the UI it is easy to confuse it as discarding actions. Is this the same as the Clear action mentioned at https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2266 ?

**Describe the solution you'd like**
allow undo and redoing actions using keyboard shortcuts &| add buttons near Validate and Discard buttons. This can be done by keeping a limited buffer of actions (at least until the user clicks save) as also described [here
](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/1711#issuecomment-1289234621)

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
😭  and do it all again

title: Error when logging large text

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
When I try to log a large text, the following error occurs:
```bash
argilla.client.sdk.commons.errors.GenericApiError: Argilla server returned an error with http status: 500
Error details: [{'code': 'argilla.api.errors::GenericServerError', 'params': {'type': 'elasticsearch.helpers.BulkIndexError', 'message': '1 document(s) failed to index.'}}]
```


**To Reproduce**
Execute the following Python script:
```python

import spacy
import argilla as rg

if __name__ == '__main__':
    nlp = spacy.load('en_core_web_sm')

    text = 'hello ' * 10000

    record = rg.TokenClassificationRecord(
        text=text,
        tokens=[token.text for token in nlp(text)],
        prediction=[('label1', 0, len(text), 1)]    
    )

    rg.log(record, 'test')
```


**Expected behavior**
The previous record is uploaded.


**Environment**
Python client: `argilla==1.2.1`
Server: The following Docker Compose
```yaml
version: "3.9"

services:
  argilla:
    image: argilla/argilla-server:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "6900:6900"
    environment:
      ARGILLA_ELASTICSEARCH: http://elasticsearch:9200
    networks:
      - argilla
  elasticsearch:
    image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:8.5.3
    environment:
      - node.name=elasticsearch
      - cluster.name=es-argilla-local
      - discovery.type=single-node
      - "ES_JAVA_OPTS=-Xms512m -Xmx512m"
      - cluster.routing.allocation.disk.threshold_enabled=false
      - xpack.security.enabled=false
    ulimits:
      memlock:
        soft: -1
        hard: -1
    networks:
      - argilla
    ports:
      - "9200:9200"
      - "9300:9300"
    volumes:
      - elasticdata:/usr/share/elasticsearch/data/
  kibana:
    image: docker.elastic.co/kibana/kibana:8.5.3
    ports:
      - "5601:5601"
    environment:
      ELASTICSEARCH_URL: http://elasticsearch:9200
      ELASTICSEARCH_HOSTS: '["http://elasticsearch:9200"]'
    networks:
      - argilla
networks:
  argilla:
    driver: bridge
volumes:
  elasticdata:
```

title: Validate predictions fails on Text2Text

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body: **Describe the bug** On version 1.2.1 when validating the prediction on text2text (see for example `news-summary` dataset, we get an error that the annotation couldn't be validated. The reason is that apparently, the JSON payload that we send does not contain the text field inside the annotation.text objects. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to `news-summary` 2. Open the browser inspector and refresh if neccesary 3. Click on Hand labelling 4. Find a record with predictions but not validated 5. You'll see the error pop and on the inspector, you'll that the call to save the annotations fails because the above missing field `text` error. I've only tested with page size 1 but I guess it's the same with other page sizes as it shouldn't affect this **Expected behavior** Save the annotation when validating the predictions **Screenshots** **Environment (please complete the following information):** - OS [e.g. iOS]: - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: - Argilla Version [e.g. 1.0.0]: - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. argilla:v1.0.0]: **Additional context** Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Refactoring to prepare bulk annotation
body:
**This is part of the refactoring : #2142 at AppHeader level.**

**Description** : in order to avoid over rendering and complexity, we can pass only what is necessary to the differents child components (instead of all the dataset object) and remove unecessary < slot > tag when not needed.

**Process** : To do an iterative refactoring, this refactoring will concerned 5 components (the direct parents of AnnotationLabelSelector.vue, this component will be replaced in the bulk annotation feature) and 2 components to help future implementations for the other tasks.

The direct parents :
- **ValidateDiscard.vue**
- **GlobalActions.vue**
- **TextClassificationHeader.vue**
- **AppHeader**
- **index.vue**

Other :
- **TokenClassificationHeader.vue**
- **Text2TextClassificationHeader.vue**


For more info, go to https://excalidraw.com/#json=oAq-FFZ9h7dAqmSF0BsnY,XZiBBXc4Mud_R34KMy179Q. **All the components in red will be refactored**

title: Allow to configure the pagination limit from server

labels.name: area: server
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the server

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
The current pagination flow has a limit of 10k since elasticsearch set a default safeguard limit when requesting docs with a high `from` value.

But this value can be increased by configuration. The problem is, even if the user defines a higher value on the elasticsearch level, the change won't be reflected.

We should allow adapting this value to the setup in the elasticsearch cluster.

See also discussion [here](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pull/2231#issuecomment-1399982416)

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When I display the `inputs={}` on the Argilla UI, I would like to have a way to sort the **keys**:values of the dictionary.  I need this feature to help the labeler do the job easier. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I want to be able to control the sort criteria for the inputs.  Like:  Date **yymm01**: will be shown before Date **yymm02**:.   Or **BEFORE**: text a can be be shown first and then **AFTER**: text b

body:
When the dataset contains more than 10000+ records, users can't access part of the dataset. Even more critical, users could think records are missing.

- Show total record numbers existing in the dataset (instead of 10000) at the right bottom counter.
- Improve the copy that informs the limit reach (view screenshots)

title: DVC Tutorial Some Starting Changes and recommendations.
body:
Hey! Thanks for reaching out to propose a Tutorial review... I´ve proposed some changes, but there are some high level questions that I would like to address here as it might imply rethinking

* The first diagram. It is very cool , but It´s centered on model versioning and not data versioning . Maybe this [one](https://dvc.org/doc/use-cases/versioning-data-and-models) ? If not, maybe adding a footnote that the pkl model can be also understood as data
* Remotes. You talk here about GDrive, but to be honest I think we could squeeze it more going for AWS , they are one of our most common use cases . How would you feel about extract the most useful information from [here](https://iterative.ai/blog/aws-remotes-in-dvc/)  Let´s keep this discussion!

title: Investigate how to automate help modal content from the docs

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
We will continuously create more "help content".
We are improving the modal UI to display many help content on the same view, it would be interesting to tackle how to reuse content from the docs and display it automatically in the UI 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
For now, only do research and think about the whole context
- UX How much "help text" can be reasonably shown at a time?
- UX What are the options to do it scalable? (slider menu, search engine...)
- UI FRONT Check the markdown 
- FRONT, DOC STRUCTURE Do we need to create a new text entry into the docs?

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Duplicate info and do it manually

**Additional context**
It's a nice to have feature, it's not high prioritary

title: Date fields are being mishandled in the metadata search option

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
The date fields on the metadata do not display correctly on the metadata filtering.

**To Reproduce**
Create a multilabel text classification dataset with dates in the metadata column with the format 2023-01-15, they are text type when they get imported into the TextClassificationRecord. The date displays properly with record.metadata.get("date") but do not show up properly in the UI

**Expected behavior**
Ideally a date range slider timeline or at least a list of dates in the dataset

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3661965/213015690-320cfa87-c824-42d5-bfe0-b2b5dc98deeb.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3661965/213015755-a05bd558-2dea-4f6a-b08c-412ce53a0462.png)


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Windows Server 2019
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: Chrome
 - Argilla Version [e.g. 1.0.0]: 1.1.0
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: 8.3
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. argilla:v1.0.0]: NA

**Additional context**
Seems to be an elasticsearch related issue.

title: Load data in a data chunk loop

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The `rb.load` method will load all matched records at once. We should fetch the data in chunks and use the `id_from` to properly fetch data in a loop.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
`rg.load` should use request data with a chunk size, yield results, and loop until everything is fetched. This will avoid timeout problems.


**Describe alternatives you've considered**
N.A.

**Additional context**
N.A.

Installing v1.2.0 with Python 3.8.5 and running the server with `python -m argilla` fails due to a call to str.removesuffix which is apparently supported starting with py3.9.

This doesn't happen when installing 1.1.1.
